text: Potter is an unincorporated community in Atchison County, Kansas, United States. It is on highway K-74. It is south of Atchison. == History == Potter grew in 1886 because of railroad being built there. It was named for Joseph Potter, a pioneer settler. Potter had a post office with ZIP code 66077. It opened on May 14, 1865, and closed on May 16, 2009. == References == == Other websites == * Atchison County maps: Current , Historic , KDOT Category:Settlements in Atchison County, Kansas Category:Unincorporated communities in Kansas Category:1886 establishments in the United States
title: Potter, Kansas
